title: Cooper Black Milk Carton
content:
Anyone know where I can get a Cooper Black generic milk carton? I’ve seen this in numerous movies and TV shows. I realize this a bit strange but I thought perhaps someone here would know where I could find one. Most people I’ve talked to don’t know what Cooper Black is so I thought I’d ask here. I hope someone can help.

Cheers!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/milkcarton2_5170.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/pl_5448.jpg)

 [‹ A full set of supercript glyphs](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31879 "Go to previous forum topic") [Tattoo/Tribal Vector Art ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31853 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Gareth

comments.content:
sad to say, but i don’t believe that is our beloved Cooper Black.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/CooperBlack_4567.jpg)
If you want one of those you’ll need a time machine or ebay, because they stopped making them that way.
Can’t help you with the carton, but the face looks more like [Windsor](http://web.archive.org/web/20071115033750/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stephensonblake/windsor/).

How embarassing! (My face is about as red as the Typophile logo) I just assumed and I guess I know what that makes me. The sad part is I really should have known better. I still want to find that carton though. Anybody here in props?
